intro: Erythrina mossambicensis, commonly known as the Mozambique flame tree, is a deciduous leguminous tree native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its striking red, flame-like inflorescences that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant has pinnate leaves with 10–20 pairs of elliptical leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in tropical and subtropical regions. The tree is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, improving soil fertility.
